name: Sofi Marinova
description: '''Sofiya''' '''Marinova Kamenova''' ({{langx|bg|София Маринова Каменова}}, {{IPA|bg|soˈfi maˈrinova|pron}}), better known simply as '''Sofi Marinova''' ({{Langx|bg|Софи Маринова}}) is a [[Bulgarians|Bulgarian]] [[Chalga|pop-folk]] and ethno-pop singer. She has won multiple music awards and contests. She is often called "the Romani pearl" and "the Romani nightingale". In February 2012, she won the Bulgarian Eurovision national final with the song "[[Love Unlimited (Sofi Marinova song)|Love Unlimited]]", thus becoming the representative of Bulgaria in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2012|2012 Eurovision Song Contest]] in [[Baku]], [[Azerbaijan]].
